intro: Galeottia fimbriata, commonly known as the fringeleaf galeottia, is a rare and striking member of the Apiaceae family. Native to the high-altitude regions of Mexico, it is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
